title: Measures of Anchoring in Estimation Tasks

exp_1_calibration.population: Students at the University of California, Berkeley

exp_1_anchored_estimation.population: Students at the University of California, Berkeley

exp_3_wtp_estimation.population: Referenced from Green, Jacowitz, Kahneman, & McFadden (1995)

steps: A calibration group provides numerical estimates and confidence ratings for 15 uncertain quantities.
Baseline distributions are established, and anchors are set at the 15th and 85th percentiles of the calibration estimates.
Experimental participants are presented with a quantity and a specified anchor (high or low).
Participants judge whether the true value of the quantity is higher or lower than the specified anchor.
Participants provide a numerical estimate for the quantity.
Participants rate their confidence in their estimate on a 10-point scale.
In a replication study (Exp 2), a manipulation is added to discredit the informational value of the anchor.
In a public goods study (Exp 3), participants perform a dichotomous judgment (referendum) before providing a numerical Willingness to Pay (WTP) estimate.
